author: ESPN staff
title: Altinordu would reject Lionel Messi, even if he played for free - chairman
text:
about an hour ago Altinordu would reject Lionel Messi, even if he played for free - chairman Barcelona president Josep Bartomeu says the team were sad to hear of Luis Enrique's decision to step down as manager. The ESPN FC guys run through the early list of favourites to become Barcelona's next manager. The FC panel assess Luis Enrique's plans to leave Barcelona and discuss his chances of departing with a La Liga title. Following Barcelona's demolition of Sporting Gijon, Luis Enrique said that his squad is becoming more familiar with his tactic changes. Barca made quick work of 18th-place Sporting Gijon as Lionel Messi, Luis Suarez and Neymar all found the back of the net. 
Altinordu chairman Mehmet Seyit Ozkan has said Barcelona forward Lionel Messi could not play for the club, even if he offered to do so for free. 
The Turkish second division side plan to build a team solely made up of players trained at the club, and have invested in a huge youth academy program buying up hundreds of acres of land around the Izmir region. 
Ozkan said : "Even if Messi came to me and said I will play a season at Altinordu for free I would tell him no. I believe in our philosophy and will not deviate from our goals, we will continue to train local players. 
"How far can we go? That depends on the players we produce, we will determine our own success." 
Messi, who has won the Champions League four times with Barcelona and received the FIFA Ballon d'Or on four occasions. Meanwhile, Altinordu are ninth in the Turkish second tier.
